Using Mathjax on Slack with Chrome extension

I refered Stackoverflow posts as following. My contents.js version is here:

 1 function LoadMathJax() {
 2   window.MathJax = null;
 3   if (!window.MathJax) {
 4     if (document.body.innerHTML.match(/$|\\\[|\\\(|<([a-z]+:)math/)) {
 5       var script = document.createElement("script");
 6       script.type = "text/javascript";
 7       script.src = "//cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML";
 8       script.text = [
 9         "MathJax.Hub.Config({",
10         "tex2jax: {inlineMath: [['$','$'],['\\\\\(','\\\\\)']]}",
11         "});"
12       ].join("\n");
13       var parent = (document.head || document.body || document.documentElement);
14       parent.appendChild(script);
15     }
16   }
17 }
18 
19 var script = document.createElement("script");
20 script.type = "text/javascript";
21 script.text = "(" + LoadMathJax + ")()";
22 var parent = (document.head || document.body || document.documentElement);
23 setTimeout(function () {
24   parent.appendChild(script);
25   parent.removeChild(script);
26 },1000);

It would be get you the result.

The download link is my complete zip archive that contains Chrome extension: /resources/slack_mathjax.zip

## References
